subject: Writing
title: The Panama Papers: The Biggest Leak in History
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Panama Papers: The Biggest Leak in History.

hook.text: 11.5 million documents. 214,000 shell companies. The largest data leak in journalism history.

buildup.text: In 2016, an anonymous source leaked internal files from Panamanian law firm Mossack Fonseca.

discovery.text: The files revealed how world leaders, billionaires, and celebrities hid wealth in offshore shell companies.

twist.text: Over 400 journalists from 80 countries collaborated in secret for a year before publishing simultaneously.

climax.text: Iceland's prime minister resigned within days. Investigations launched in dozens of countries.

punchline.text: One anonymous source shook every government on Earth.

quiz.question: How many documents were in the Panama Papers leak?
